casebody.data:
Case No. 17,053. WALCOTT v. WILCUTT. District Court, D. Massachusetts. May, 1838. Shipping — Abduction op Minor by Master — Liability op Owners. [See Sherwood v. Hall. Case No. 12,777; Lus-com v. Osgood, Id. 8,608.]

[Cited in 2 Pars. Shipp. & Adm. 11, to the point that the owners of a whaling vessel are liable for damages for the abduction of a minor by the captain, although they had no personal Unowl-' *1353edge of the fact; the act held to be within the scope of the authority of the master as agent of the owners.]

[Nowhere reported; opinion not now accessible.]
